column4: need help running libreoffice command as www-data (within apache2)
what?? why would you need to do that?
I need to generate a pdf file from a dynamically generated docx file within a Django application (talk about tough requirements)
libreoffice --headles more_stuff seems to do the trick, but I can't run it from my python app since it doesn't seem to have permissions
im sure there are other more appropriate (ie command line) applications that can do docx->pdf conversion
libreoffice is the only one that I've found that does good quality conversions
the permissions really shouldn't matter. unless apparmor or selinux are involved any application can run any binary
it works within my django dev server, but when I try to run it in a real deployment environment (aka in apache) it doesn't work
and there seems to be other people with the same problem
can you run other binaries from django?
and it returns ugly exit codes like 19712
does it work if you unset DISPLAY?
in the development environment that is
just to clarify, both django server and apache are on the same machine (apache is a replica from my actual deployment server)

i dont know enough about your development environment. im just saying the possibilities are (a) environment is wrong for libre (b) apache is configured not to let you run the application. thats really it
one would think that libreoffice --headless would work even if X variables like $XAUTHORITY and $DISPLAY are unset, but perhaps its buggy
